info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued October 14 at 1:31AM EDT until October 17 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville FL
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected.
* WHERE...Coastal Flagler and Southeast Coastal St. Johns Counties.
* WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 6 AM EDT Wednesday. For the High Rip Current Risk, from this evening through late Thursday night.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction:
If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

parameter.value: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IS CANCELLED

area.areaDesc: Coastal Flagler; Southeast Coastal St. Johns
